**Postponement of Annual Meeting (budget vote) and General Election (board members) to June 16, 2020**

The date of the annual meeting (budget vote) and general election (board members) has been changed from June 9, 2020 to June 16, 2020.

By Executive Order 202.39, the Governor has ordered that:

School districts receive absentee ballots via personal delivery through 5:00 p.m. on June 9, 2020, only. After this deadline, the school district may no longer accept absentee ballots in person.

School districts must continue to receive absentee ballots via the United States Postal Service through 5:00 p.m. on June 16, 2020.

On June 16, 2020, after 5:00 p.m., school districts may begin the process of canvassing and counting absentee ballots.

We are excited to bring this opportunity to our community and thank the organizations involved for their generous donation.

The students in the 8th grade Chinese Class celebrated a with Mrs. Donohue, and their teacher, Mrs. Balian. The students in Mrs. Balian's class have been learning about the traditions and customs associated with the Chinese New Year!! One tradition is the custom of decorating doors. They also shop for candy, fruit, and flowers, and the "Red Envelope" which contains money. The red color of the envelope symbolizes good luck. The money symbolizes the wish for good fortune. They buy new red clothes and have their hair cut. On New Year's Eve they have a lot of food, spring rolls, dumplings, and fish - symbolizing they will have a surplus of food in this new year. Families will also watch the New Year's Gala together on TV. The New Year celebration will last for fifteen days until the Lantern Festival. This year is the Year of the Rat.

Happy Chinese New Year from the 8th grade Chinese Class!!
